title: Bolsonaro Faces Coup Charges, Sought Asylum Amid Probe
snippets: Bolsonaro is awaiting a Supreme Court ruling about an alleged coup attempt and learned Wednesday he might face another case as police formally accused him and one of his son of obstruction of justice
Police claim Brazil's ex-President Jair Bolsonaro wrote letter seeking asylum in Argentina amid coup probe.
Authorities say they found evidence on the ex-president's cell phone requesting political asylum in Argentina. Bolsonaro is currently under house arrest.

Brazil’s former president is accused of allegedly plotting a military coup, but he denies the charges

Brazilian police have claimed in court documents that they have found a document on the mobile phone of former president Jair Bolsonaro suggesting he had planned to flee to Argentina ahead
The police said they found a request for asylum, addressed to Argentina’s leader, on the phone of the Brazilian ex-president, who is accused of plotting a coup.
titles: Brazilian police say ex-President Bolsonaro had planned to flee to Argentina
Brazil’s ex-President Bolsonaro planned asylum in Argentina, police say
Brazil: Police say Bolsonaro wanted Argentina asylum
Brazil police file court documents accusing Bolsonaro of planning to flee to Argentina to seek asylum
Jair Bolsonaro Planned to Seek Asylum in Argentina, Brazil’s Police Say
summary: Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro, currently under house arrest, faces allegations of attempting a coup and obstructing justice, alongside his son. Authorities have discovered a document on Bolsonaro's cell phone indicating he sought political asylum in Argentina amid the coup probe. The Supreme Court is yet to rule on the case, as Bolsonaro denies the charges.

title: Sony Raises PlayStation 5 Price in U.S. to $550 Amid Economic Challenges
snippets: The Japanese technology giant cited economic challenges as it raised prices for the consoles by around $50.
Sony said on Wednesday that PlayStation 5 game consoles will cost more in the U.S. starting this week.
The PlayStation 5 is currently the most popular gaming console in America.
Sony is hiking the price of PlayStation 5 consoles in the U.S. this week, citing a "challenging economic environment."
Price hikes go into effect August 21; standard PS5 will now start at $550.
titles: Sony raises PlayStation 5 prices in US as tariff fears persist
Sony raises PlayStation 5 prices in U.S. as tariffs start to hit
Sony will pass on tariff costs to U.S. consumers by hiking PlayStation 5 prices
Sony is increasing the price of the PlayStation 5 as new tariffs take hold
Sony makes the “difficult decision” to raise PlayStation 5 prices in the US
summary: Sony announced that PlayStation 5 console prices in the U.S. will increase due to a challenging economic environment. The standard PS5 will now start at $550, up from the previous price. The price hike will be effective starting August 21. The PlayStation 5 is currently the most popular gaming console in America.

title: Bullet Fired into Andy Reid's Office at Chiefs Facility, Lands Near Desk

The incident occurred last year, and the bullet ended up just 15 feet from Reid's desk. Reid was working alone in the office at the time of the incident.

title: Court Temporarily Halts Deportation Protections for Nepali, Honduran, Nicaraguan
snippets: A federal appeals court on Wednesday sided with the Trump administration and halted for now a lower court's order that had kept in place temporary protections for 60,000 migrants from Central America and Nepal.
Appeals court pauses an order that had protected status for Nepalese, Hondurans and Nicaraguans.

Administration officials given legal right to move towards deportation of people from Nepal, Honduras and Nicaragua

A federal appeals court on Wednesday sided with the Trump administration and halted for now a
titles: Appeals court allows end of protected status for migrants from 3 countries
US court allows Trump to end temporary protections for 60,000 migrants
US court allows Trump officials to end protected status for 60,000 migrants
summary: A federal appeals court has temporarily halted an order that protected individuals from Nepal, Honduras, and Nicaragua from deportation. This decision allows Trump administration officials to proceed with deportation plans for people from these countries. The current status is a pause on the protective order, pending further legal actions.

title: Councils Review HMO Regulations After Epping Precedent, Amid Cohesion Concerns
snippets: More than half a dozen councils, including some run by Labour, are assessing their options after Epping ruling.
Local authorities tighten controls on houses in multiple occupation amid fears for community cohesion

Conservative party leader writes letter ‘encouraging’ councils to ‘take the same steps’ as Epping ‘if your legal advice supports it’

Shadow justice secretary Robert Jenrick has echoed Kemi Badenoch’s views, saying the country is “in a mess”. He told the Dai
titles: More councils consider asylum hotel legal challenges
Councils move to close off key alternative to asylum hotels in England

summary: More than half a dozen councils, some governed by Labour, are evaluating their strategies following a precedent set by Epping. This comes as local authorities are increasing regulations on houses in multiple occupation (HMOs) due to concerns over community cohesion. The Conservative party leader has issued a letter urging councils to follow Epping's lead, provided their legal advice agrees. Shadow justice secretary Robert Jenrick has supported Kemi Badenoch's perspective, describing the country as "in a mess."

title: UK July Public Sector Borrowing Hits 3-Year Low at £1.1 Billion
snippets: Borrowing last month was the lowest July figure for three years, following rises in tax and National Insurance receipts.
The £1.1bn shortfall comes as chancellor Rachel Reeves prepares for tough Autumn Budget

Public sector net borrowing falls to £1.1bn as chancellor explores tax-raising options in autumn budget

  • Business li
titles: Government borrowing lower than expected in July
UK government borrows less than expected in July
UK borrowed less than expected in July in lift for Rachel Reeves
summary: In July, UK public sector net borrowing decreased to £1.1 billion, the lowest figure for the month in three years, due to increased tax and National Insurance receipts. This development occurs as Chancellor Rachel Reeves prepares for a challenging Autumn Budget, with potential tax-raising measures under consideration.

title: Frank Caprio, "Caught in Providence" Judge and Compassionate Jurist, Dies at 88
snippets: The US celebrity judge and social media star has been remembered for his "unique brand of compassion".
Judge Frank Caprio of the TV show "Caught in Providence" has died at 88.

Host of TV show Caught in Providence billed his courtroom as a place ‘where people and cases are met with kindness’

Frank Caprio, a retired municipal judge in Rhode Island who found online fame for his compassionate nature as host of the reality courtroom series Caught in Providence, has di
titles: Frank Caprio: 'Nicest judge in the world' dies aged 88
Judge Frank Caprio, beloved for viral court videos, dies at 88 from pancreatic cancer
Frank Caprio, US judge who found fame online for his compassion, dies aged 88
summary: Frank Caprio, a retired municipal judge in Rhode Island and host of the TV show "Caught in Providence," has passed away at the age of 88. Known for his compassionate approach to justice, Caprio became a social media star and was celebrated for his unique blend of kindness in the courtroom. "Caught in Providence" was recognized for addressing cases and individuals with empathy, distinguishing Caprio's legacy in the legal community.

title: Texas House Passes GOP Maps, May Flip 5 Seats; White House Joins TikTok
snippets: After a long day of debate, the Texas House of Representatives passed GOP-favored congressional maps Wednesday evening that could flip five Democratic districts.

This liveblog is now closed

The White House launched an official TikTok account on Tuesday, as Donald Trump continues to permit the Chinese-owned platform to operate in the US despite a law requiring its sale.
Democrats who left the state to block the vote from happening began to return Monday.
titles: Texas House passes new GOP-friendly congressional maps
Texas house passes Republican-drawn gerrymandered congressional map after weeks of protest – as it happened
Texas House Passes New Gerrymandered Map—Likely Giving Republicans 5 More Congressional Seats
summary: The Texas House of Representatives approved new GOP-favored congressional maps, potentially flipping five Democratic districts to Republican. These maps are now moving to the state senate, where they are expected to pass, potentially giving Republicans five new US House seats by 2026. In a separate development, the White House launched its official TikTok account on Tuesday.

The suspension comes as a violation of the league's substance abuse policy. Robinson, who played all 17 games last season for the Rams, will miss the start of the season.

Gemini’s new Magic Cue feature allows chatbot to scan digital life and pull up relevant information

Google’s latest Gemini AI upgrades attempt to anticipate what useful information you made need from your life to address a potential issue, make you to better photographer or become your pers
Google is improving the base Pixel offering by introducing a three-rear-camera system to the Pixel 10.

Google's updates to the Pixel 10 line allow it to showcase what its latest AI technology can do when enhanced by the Tensor G5 processor, an upgrade to the company's custom silicon designed for the AI experience.
Pixel Journal is a new journaling app from Google that uses on-device AI to suggest writing prompts.
The tech giant says the new personal health coach is a fitness trainer, sleep coach, and wellness advisor all in one.

Google launches Pixel 10 with AI tools that anticipate users’ needs
Google launches the Pixel 10 series,  base model now has three cameras

summary: Google has launched updates for its Pixel 10 line, introducing a three-rear-camera system and showcasing its latest AI technology, including the Gemini assistant with features like Magic Cue. The upgrades are powered by the new Tensor G5 processor, enhancing the AI experience. Additionally, Google introduced Pixel Journal, an app using on-device AI for writing prompts, and a new personal health coach, combining a fitness trainer, sleep coach, and wellness advisor. These innovations highlight Google's focus on integrating AI into its devices to improve user experience and compete in the device

title: Israel Approves Major Settlement Expansion in West Bank's E1 Area
snippets: The plan aims to enlarge an Israeli settlement by building thousands of new apartments in the West Bank. Critics say this would essentially split the Palestinian territory and make any two-state solution untenable.

Construction would be ‘flagrant breach of international law’ and undermine two-state solution, foreign secretary says

Israel has announced it is expanding its military operations in Gaza City, as the UK foreign secretary, David Lammy, condemned its approval of a huge new illegal settlement
The long-stalled project near Jerusalem, known as E1, further fragments West Bank lands envisioned as part of a Palestinian state, advancing a goal of Israeli hard-liners.
titles: Israel approves controversial West Bank settlement plan
Israel expands Gaza City offensive as UK decries West Bank settlement approval
Israel Approves Settlements, a Blow to Faded Hopes for a Palestinian State
summary: Israel has granted final approval for a significant settlement expansion in the E1 area of the occupied West Bank, planning to build thousands of new apartments. This development is controversial because it is located in a critical area that connects Bethlehem and Ramallah, and critics argue it could split Palestinian territory in two, undermining the feasibility of a two-state solution. This move has drawn criticism from Palestinians and human rights groups, who believe it could jeopardize the prospects for a future Palestinian state.

summary: The Pixel 10 series features a gearless hinge for a larger outer display and improved durability compared to the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. The new phones offer a power upgrade but lack a SIM card slot.

title: Saints Trade for Broncos' Vele, Exchange Two Future Picks
snippets: The Saints added to their receiver room ahead of the regular-season opener Wednesday, acquiring Devaughn Vele in a trade with the Broncos, who received two future draft picks in return.
The Denver Broncos are alleviating some of the crowding in their wide receiver room by sending second-year pro Devaughn Vele to the New Orleans Saints for a pair of draft picks.
titles: Saints acquire WR Vele, send picks to Broncos
Saints acquire second-year WR Devaughn Vele from Broncos for draft picks
summary: The New Orleans Saints acquired wide receiver Devaughn Vele from the Denver Broncos in exchange for two future draft picks, a fourth-rounder in next year's draft and a seventh-rounder in 2027. This trade aims to bolster the Saints' receiver options ahead of the season opener. As a result, the Saints are left with five picks in the 2026 draft and won't have a full slate of draft selections until 2028. The move helps the Broncos reduce their surplus of wide receivers.

title: India Test-Fires Agni-5 Missile, Capable of Reaching All of China
snippets: The government said that the intermediate-range ballistic missile could carry several nuclear warheads. Prime Minister Modi has said India needs to be more self-reliant.

Agni-5 intermediate-range ballistic missile also part of Narendra Modi’s defence strategy against Pakistan

India has said it successfully test-fired an intermediate-range ballistic missile that, when operational, should be capable of carrying a nuclear warhead to any part of China.

Th
titles: India launches nuclear-capable missile test
India ‘successfully tests’ nuclear-capable missile able to reach deep into China
summary: India successfully test-fired the Agni-5, an intermediate-range ballistic missile capable of carrying a nuclear warhead to any part of China. This development is part of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's defense strategy, emphasizing the need for India to be more self-reliant. The missile is also designed to carry several nuclear warheads and is aimed at enhancing India's defense capabilities against Pakistan.

title: Doss High in Louisville Bans Cellphones to Boost Focus
snippets: Jamel Bishop is seeing a big change in his classrooms as he begins his senior year at Doss High School in Louisville, Kentucky, where cellphones are now banned during instructional time.

Jamel Bishop is seeing a big change in his classrooms as he begins his senior year at Doss High School in Louisville, Kentucky, where cellphones are now banned during instructional time. In previous years, students often weren’t paying attention and wasted class time by repeating questions, th
titles: Students face new cellphone restrictions in 17 states as school year begins
Students face new cellphone restrictions in 17 states as school year begins
summary: As Jamel Bishop starts his senior year at Doss High School in Louisville, Kentucky, a significant policy change has been implemented: cellphones are now banned during instructional time. This measure aims to improve focus and reduce wasted class time previously lost to distractions from cellphone use.

title: Jake Paul to Fight Gervonta Davis in Atlanta on Nov 14
snippets: YouTuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul will face off against Gervonta 'Tank' Davis at State Farm Arena on November 14.
YouTuber-turned-cruiserweight boxer Jake Paul and undefeated WBA lightweight champion Gervonta “Tank” Davis have agreed to fight on Nov. 14 at Atlanta’s State Farm Arena.
titles: Jake Paul to fight Gervonta Davis, WBA lightweight boxing champ, in Atlanta
Jake Paul and Gervonta Davis announce they will fight on Nov. 14
summary: Jake Paul, a YouTuber-turned-cruiserweight boxer, is set to fight undefeated WBA lightweight champion Gervonta "Tank" Davis on November 14 at the State Farm Arena in Atlanta, Georgia. This match-up features two prominent figures from different weight classes, with Paul competing at 200 pounds and Davis at 135 pounds.

title: Trump Buys $100M in Bonds After Second Term Inauguration
snippets: Trump's investments include Meta, Wells Fargo, Morgan Stanley, Citigroup, and T-Mobile, according to filing.
The U.S. president has purchased hundreds of bonds issued by companies, local governments and school boards.
titles: Trump has bought more than $100m in bonds in office, disclosure shows
Trump has snapped up more than $100 million in bonds since taking office
summary: After his inauguration for a second term, U.S. President Donald Trump bought more than $100 million in bonds from companies, state governments, and school boards. Forms made public reveal that Trump made over 600 financial transactions the day following his inauguration, indicating significant post-inauguration investment activities.

title: Italian Duo Advances, Draper and Pegula Out at US Open Mixed Doubles
snippets:
In a draw filled with many of the best singles tennis players in the world, the Italians made a decisive case for the importance of teamwork in this discipline

Across two frantic days in New York, Andrea Vavassori and Sara Errani repeatedly made their intentions clear. As the only doubles s

Meanwhile, Jack Draper and Jessica Pegula were eliminated from the mixed doubles tournament after losing an intense semi-final match to Casper Ruud and Iga Swiatek. This highlights the competitive nature of the event and the diverse talents across singles and doubles formats.

title: Errani and Vavassori Win US Open Mixed Doubles, Defeat Swiatek and Ruud
snippets: Italian pair Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori complete their "mission" by beating Iga Swiatek and Casper Ruud to win the revamped US Open mixed event.

Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori weren’t even sure they would get to defend their U.S. Open mixed doubles title. Organizers revamped the tournament because they wanted singles superstars, not doubles specialists.
titles: 'Mission completed' - doubles specialists win US Open mixed title
Errani, Vavassori win revamped US Open mixed doubles to defend title
summary: Italian duo Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori won the US Open mixed doubles event, defeating Iga Swiatek and Casper Ruud. Despite uncertainties about their participation due to the tournament's focus on singles players, Errani and Vavassori successfully defended their title in the revamped competition.

title: NASA Study Suggests Ceres May Have Supported Microbial Life
snippets: New NASA research has found that Ceres may have had a lasting source of chemical energy: the right types of molecules needed to fuel some microbial metabolisms. Although there is no evidence that microorganisms ever existed on Ceres, the finding supports theories that this intriguing dwarf planet, w

The dwarf planet is cold now, but new research paints a picture of Ceres hosting a deep, long-lived energy source that may have maintained habitable conditions in the past. New NASA research has found that Ceres may have had a lasting source of chemical energy: the right types of molecules needed to
titles: Ceres may have had long-standing energy to fuel habitability
NASA: Ceres May Have Had Long-Standing Energy to Fuel Habitability
summary: NASA's new research suggests that Ceres, a dwarf planet, may have had a lasting source of chemical energy capable of supporting microbial life by providing the necessary molecules for some microbial metabolisms. While there is no evidence of microorganisms ever living on Ceres, the findings indicate that it might have maintained conditions suitable for habitability in the past due to a deep, long-lived energy source.

This statement was made amid requests for grand jury records, as President Donald Trump faced scrutiny from both supporters and critics regarding his management of the Epstein files.

titles: Astronomers combine X-ray and radio data to map pulsar 'hand' nebula

Recently, the Australia Telescope Compact Array provided new radio data on this celestial object, enhancing our understanding of its structure and properties.

title: "Peacemaker Season 2 Premieres on HBO Max, Expands DC Universe"
snippets: Season two of James Gunn's "Peacemaker" debuts on HBO Max a month after the release of "Superman." Here's how the show fits into the new DC Universe timeline.

The show's debut aligns with the new DC Universe timeline, offering fans more of the character's adventures. The series is now available for streaming and cable viewing, marking its return for another season.

title: Google Unveils Pixel 10 and Gemini at Made by Google 2025 Event

title: UCSF Scientists Identify Protein Linked to Brain Aging, Potential Treatment Path
snippets: Scientists at UCSF have uncovered a surprising culprit behind brain aging: a protein called FTL1. In mice, too much FTL1 caused memory loss, weaker brain connections, and sluggish cells. But when researchers blocked it, the animals regained youthful brain function and sharp memory. The discovery sug

Researchers discovered two brain regions that work as a “neural compass,” keeping people oriented in virtual city navigation. These areas tracked direction consistently, hinting at new ways to detect and monitor neurological disorders that cause disorientation.
titles: Scientists just found a protein that reverses brain aging
Scientists just found the brain’s secret GPS system
summary: Scientists at UCSF identified a protein, FTL1, as a key factor in brain aging, causing memory loss and weaker brain connections in mice. Blocking FTL1 reversed these effects, suggesting a potential target for treating age-related cognitive decline. Additionally, researchers found two brain regions acting as a "neural compass" for orientation in virtual environments. This discovery could lead to new methods for diagnosing and monitoring neurological disorders that impair navigational skills.
